messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2214
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/9/02 7:28:52 PM, lurningathome@aol.com writes:  I remember forgetting a LOT of what I learned in college
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/9/02 7:28:52 PM, lurningathome@... writes:

<< > I remember forgetting a LOT of what I learned in college

<<Oh shoot Sandra..... I don't remember anything ....LOL
Wait.... I do remember fighting from being bored and falling asleep. >>

I learned as much outside the classroom as in.

Recorder-playing and Renaissance music, more ballads than I had known before
I went there, how to throw pots. But even in class I learned a ton of things
I still pursue and use. Learning theory, applied psychology, linguistics,
Shakespeare, Chaucer (that has tied in with lots of things; still does),
cultural anthropology, comparative religion. Some of those things I was
interested in before. More, I knew nothing about. But I kept looking into
them after I left school.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2214
messages.msgSnippet: exactly.. that is what i find disturbing.. that we spend more time worrying over how evil hitler was when the same things are still happening on the planet.. L
messages.messageBody:
exactly.. that is what i find disturbing.. that we spend more time worrying over how evil hitler was when the same things are still happening on the planet..
L LL

Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2214

True.......but I think about all the native tribes that know longer exist ,
how thousands if not millions were killed, the middle passages where over 250
million died, then Saddem Hussein who has killed his on people, etc..., then
there is Rwanda with the millions lost to ethnic cleansing.....no one is
learning their lessons..... the situation in Crotia, etc...... It keeps
going......

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/8/2002 4:16:09 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Hell is a really stupid idea. I wouldn't worship anyone who would come up
> with an eternal fiery pit. But we could talk about where the ideas about
> hell were borrowed (to go with that Mardi Gras history), and how many
> cultures believe that and have similar names for it.
>
> I wouldn't even wish an eternal fiery pit on Hitler.
>
> Sandra

Sandra.... I have battled that thought too....... SHoot...I think we re
already living there sometimes.....lol
Anyhow....joking aside...
I have been on that thought provoking journey about that.

Kim
